title: Understanding Limits
objectives: Define the concept of a limit and its significance in calculus.
Evaluate limits graphically, numerically, and analytically.
Understand one-sided limits and their role in determining function behavior.
Explore infinite limits and limits at infinity to describe end behavior of functions.
Identify and interpret discontinuities and their types (removable, jump, infinite).
Apply the limit laws to simplify and solve complex limit expressions.
Understand the concept of continuity and how it relates to limits.

title: Introduction to Derivatives
objectives: Understand the derivative as the instantaneous rate of change and slope of a tangent line.
Define derivatives using first principles (the limit definition of a derivative).
Interpret real-world meaning of derivatives in physical and graphical contexts.
Differentiate basic algebraic functions using limit rules.
Identify points where a function is not differentiable.
Explore the relationship between differentiability and continuity.
Introduce notation for derivatives: Leibniz, Lagrange, and Newton forms.
